citeinfo.origin: National Fisheries Research and Development Institute (NFRDI), Korea Oceanographic Data Centre (KODC)
citeinfo.title: Sea Surface Temperature (SST) Image Data Around the Korean Peninsula

descript.abstract:
The national Fisheries Research and Development Institute (NFRDI) of Korea operates NOAA ground receiving station in Kijang (35 11.5'N, 129 13.4'E), eastern part of Busan. Operation began November 2, 1989 with work is in real time Sea Surface Temperature (SST) mapping in Korean coastal waters derived from NOAA-AVHRR on daily base. Data includes NOAA data 4-6 times a day in case of satellite elevation more than 30 degrees. An autoprocess of SST color image has been developed.
[ Reference: PICES Scientific Report No. 18 2001, Proceedings of the PICES/CoML/IPRC Workshop on "Impact of Climate Variability on Observation and Prediction of Ecosystem and Biodiversity Changes in the North Pacific", http://www.pices.int/publications/scientific_reports/Report18/default.aspx. ]
descript.purpose: To extend and evaluate potential fishing grounds and to access marine environmental quality.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.
